Homepage.name: I'm Milena Sol Aron
Homepage.role: Software Developer focused on DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

About.introduction: I'm Milena Sol Aron, a Software Developer based in Argentina, currently transitioning into DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). I have over two years of experience in the field, as I started working as a Software Developer in 2023.
About.currently: I'm pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science at the University of the People, which allows me to continue working full time as a Software Developer while studying DevOps and SRE at my own pace.
About.linux: My interest in IT began when I was eight years old, creating and designing my own blog using HTML and CSS. However, my true passion for technology deepened in 2015, when I started using Linux at the age of 13. Since then, I haven't stopped using it, and my love for this operating system has only grown.
About.about-website-technologies: The technologies used are Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and next-intl.
About.about-likes-1: Working with my two cats (one of the biggest advantages that working remotely gives me).
About.about-likes-2: The feeling of satisfaction after solving a problem or making an improvement in the code.
About.about-likes-3: The book The Pragmatic Programmer, by Andy Hunt and Dave Thomas. It taught me a lot of things that I apply every day.
About.about-likes-4: Linux: I really love it. It's one of my biggest passions.
About.goal-paragraph-1: When I have the appropiate seniority and experience, I would like to become a technical lead or software architect. I know I still have a lot to learn, but I like to direct my career towards that goal.
About.goal-paragraph-2: Meanwhile, I develop CarreraIT, a web platform to help other people in the field through free resources, orientation guides and articles that I write, and surveys with feedback.

Resume.about-1: Software developer with more than two years of experience in the field.Currently, I'm deepening my knowledge of GNU/Linux and studying DevOps practices, while also pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science at the University of the People at my own pace.
Resume.about-2: I have been using GNU/Linux as my only operating system since 2015. Currently, I use the Fedora distribution.
Resume.job3-responsibility-1: Development of custom Shopify apps using Meteor, TypeScript, React.js, Express.js, GraphQL, and MongoDB.
Resume.job3-responsibility-2: Design and implement GitLab CI/CD pipelines to automate code linting, testing, building, and deployment workflows.
Resume.job3-responsibility-3: Unit and app testing with Mocha and Chai and end-to-end testing with Cypress.
Resume.job2-responsibility-1: Development of an AI platform using WordPress, JavaScript, PHP, HTML and CSS.
Resume.job1-responsibility-1: Front-end development of a platform for students using Next.js, React, TypeScript and Tailwind CSS.
Resume.job1-responsibility-2: Front-end development of landing pages with Vite, React, Tailwind CSS and TypeScript.
Resume.job1-responsibility-3: Back-end development for web scraping using Express.js, JavaScript, SQLite and Puppeteer.
Resume.job1-responsibility-4: Back-end development with Nest.js, Docker, TypeORM and MySQL in training projects.
Resume.education1-description: I'm currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science at the University of the People, which allows me to study at my own pace while continuing to work full-time.
Resume.certification3-name: Introduction to DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (LFS162)
